original: zhes brjod pa kho bo cag gis phyogs gcig shes pa tsam gyis dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes par khas len par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa kho bo cag gis phyogs gcig shes pa tsam gyis dngos po ma lus pa yongs su shes par khas len par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not accept that one knows all things by knowing one part of them.

original: 'on kyang shes rab phul du gyur bar dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don yongs su shes pas byas pa'i khyad par de las te goms pa las 'phel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes rab phul du gyur bar dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don yongs su shes pas byas pa'i khyad par de las te goms pa las 'phel ba'i phyir te /
translated: However, because of the special knowledge that arises from the special cultivation of the wisdom that transcends the senses, it is possible that the special knowledge of the ultimate object is attained.

original: rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i khyad par thob pa'i phyir gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar srid do //
analyzed: rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i khyad par thob pa'i phyir gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar srid do //
translated: This is because the special knowledge of the ultimate object is attained by reaching the culmination of the special cultivation of wisdom.

original: 'di ni sngar grub zin kyang yang tshad ma byed pa na sbyor ba gang dang gang yid kyi yon tan yin pa de dag ni goms pa phul du byung ba na rab kyi mthar thug par 'jug par srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar grub zin kyang yang tshad ma byed pa na sbyor ba gang dang gang yid kyi yon tan yin pa de dag ni goms pa phul du byung ba na rab kyi mthar thug par 'jug par srid pa yin te /
translated: Even though this has already been established, when it is being established again, it is possible that whatever mental qualities are produced by the special cultivation of wisdom will reach the culmination of the special knowledge of the ultimate object.

original: dper na gtsang sgra can dang ro bsreg mkhan brtse ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gtsang sgra can dang ro bsreg mkhan brtse ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, this is like the son of a prostitute and the son of a brahman.

original: shes rab kyang yid kyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyang yid kyi yon tan yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: Wisdom is also a quality of the mind. This is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason uncertain.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can shes rab ni don ma lus pa yongs su shes pa med par rab kyi mthar thug par 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can shes rab ni don ma lus pa yongs su shes pa med par rab kyi mthar thug par 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: For, wisdom, which is characterized by the realization of the nature of reality, cannot reach the highest point without the complete understanding of all things.

original: khyad par ma grub pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ma grub pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished, because of the nonestablishment of the distinction.

original: goms pa'i khyad par srid pa ni rgyas par sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par srid pa ni rgyas par sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the possibility of a special cultivation has been established in detail earlier.

original: rab kyi mtha'i sgra ni phul du byung ba'i rnam grangs so //üîΩrnam @308b pa gcig tu na gang dag rigs mtshungs pa snga ma'i sa bon las byung ba de dag ni legs par bya ba'i khyad par yod na shin tu 'phel ba'i chos dang ldan pa srid pa yin te /
analyzed: rab kyi mtha'i sgra ni phul du byung ba'i rnam grangs so // rnam @308b pa gcig tu na gang dag rigs mtshungs pa snga ma'i sa bon las byung ba de dag ni legs par bya ba'i khyad par yod na shin tu 'phel ba'i chos dang ldan pa srid pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhighest‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúexcellent.‚Äù

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Or, those things that arise from a previous seed of the same class have the property of increasing greatly when there is a special cultivation, for example, a seed of rice.

original: brtse ba dang shes rab la sogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i chos dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: brtse ba dang shes rab la sogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i chos dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: and he is endowed with love, wisdom, etc., as they have been explained. This is a natural reason.

original: 'di yang snga ma bzhin du ma grub pa dang ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang snga ma bzhin du ma grub pa dang ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: And this is not unestablished or indeterminate, as in the previous case.

original: blo ni shes rab po //
analyzed: blo ni shes rab po //
translated: Mind is wisdom.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Endowed with the qualities as they have been explained,

original: rigs dang mtshungs pa snga ma'i sa bon las 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs dang mtshungs pa snga ma'i sa bon las 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he is of the same kind as the family, which means that he has the seed of the former stage.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang dag gnyen po'i phyogs nye ba na 'grib ba'i chos su 'jug pa de dag ni gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba na shin tu 'grib pa'i chos dang ldan pa srid pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang dag gnyen po'i phyogs nye ba na 'grib ba'i chos su 'jug pa de dag ni gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba na shin tu 'grib pa'i chos dang ldan pa srid pa yin te /
translated: Or, in another way, those things which are subject to decrease when the antidote is near, are also subject to a great decrease when the antidote is greatly increased.

original: dper na gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the impurities of gold, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du gyur ba na 'grib pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnyen po'i phyogs mngon sum du gyur ba na 'grib pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And desire, etc. are also subject to decrease when the antidote, which is the knowledge of selflessness, is present. This is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not an unestablished inference,

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdag med pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig 'gal bar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bdag med pa'i shes pa dang lhan cig 'gal bar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: because it has been established that the knowledge of selflessness, etc. is contradictory with the afflictions, etc.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it uncertain,

original: gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is impossible for the antidote to increase and the object to be abandoned to remain.

original: de lta ma yin na gang zhig rtsa ba nas 'don par mi nus pa de ji ltar cung zad 'grib par byed par me stag gi phreng ba ches gsal bar 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi nang du bcug pa'i rdo rje ni yang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba ni
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang zhig rtsa ba nas 'don par mi nus pa de ji ltar cung zad 'grib par byed par me stag gi phreng ba ches gsal bar 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi nang du bcug pa'i rdo rje ni yang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba ni
translated: Otherwise, how could the diamond, which cannot be removed from the fire, be diminished in the least when placed in a mass of flames that are blazing with a multitude of sparks?

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: It is not experienced as being diminished.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba mi srid pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba mi srid pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not indeterminate because it is impossible for the adverse side to increase excessively.

original: sngar rgyas par shin tu 'phel bar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rgyas par shin tu 'phel bar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it has been established in detail above that it increases excessively.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang dag gnyen po'i phyogs nye ba na 'grib ba'i chos can yin pa de dag ni gtan nas rtsa ba nas 'byin nus pa'i gnyen po can yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang dag gnyen po'i phyogs nye ba na 'grib ba'i chos can yin pa de dag ni gtan nas rtsa ba nas 'byin nus pa'i gnyen po can yin te /
translated: Or else, those which are subject to decrease when the side of the counteragent is near, have a counteragent which is able to eradicate them completely and from the root.

original: dper na gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the stains of gold, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the obscurations of afflictions and the knowable have the qualities as explained. This is a natural inference.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du ma grub pa dang ma nges pa la sogs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du ma grub pa dang ma nges pa la sogs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, as before, nonestablishment, inconclusiveness, etc. should be refuted.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni las kyi sgrib pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni las kyi sgrib pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the obscurations of karma, etc.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na @309a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na @309a * //
translated: Or else,

original: gang dag de kho na mthong ba la gegs byed pa de dag ni shin tu 'grib pa srid pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag de kho na mthong ba la gegs byed pa de dag ni shin tu 'grib pa srid pa yin te /
translated: Those which obstruct the seeing of reality are certainly subject to decrease,

original: dper na phyi rol gyi mtshan mo'i mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi mtshan mo'i mun pa bzhin no //
translated: just like external darkness.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa yang de kho na nyid mthong ba'i gegs byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa yang de kho na nyid mthong ba'i gegs byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience, etc. are obstructions to seeing reality. This is a natural inference.

original: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this is not indeterminate, he says,

original: de yang gzhan 'grib par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan 'grib par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And that is subject to decrease by another,

original: de yang ni nang gi mun pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ni nang gi mun pa'o //
translated: That is internal darkness.

original: yang na gang dag cig car ci zhig ltar byung ba rten brtan par 'jug pa'i khyad par 'gal ba'i rkyen med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gang dag cig car ci zhig ltar byung ba rten brtan par 'jug pa'i khyad par 'gal ba'i rkyen med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, those which arise simultaneously in some way, in order to engage in the special stability of the basis, without the special conditions which are incompatible with engagement,

original: yang 'chad pa la ltos pa de dag ni legs par bya ba'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i bye brag gis rab kyi mthar thug par 'jug pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'chad pa la ltos pa de dag ni legs par bya ba'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i bye brag gis rab kyi mthar thug par 'jug pa srid pa yin no //
translated: and which depend on further explanation, are certainly subject to engagement to the ultimate end, by the special excellence of good action.

original: dper na gser gyi rnam par dag pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi rnam par dag pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the purity of gold and so on.

original: shes rab dang brtse ba la sogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i chos dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: shes rab dang brtse ba la sogs pa yang ji skad du bshad pa'i chos dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And wisdom, compassion, and so on are endowed with the qualities as explained. This is a natural inference.

original: mchongs dang chu yi dro ba yis //
analyzed: mchongs dang chu yi dro ba yis //
translated: Jumping and the warmth of water

original: 'di la 'khrul ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul ba yod ma yin //
translated: are not mistaken in this case.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that it is qualified.

original: mchongs dang chu'i dro ba ni lan cig byas pa'i khyad par gang yang bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med par 'jug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mchongs dang chu'i dro ba ni lan cig byas pa'i khyad par gang yang bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med par 'jug pa ma yin la /
translated: Jumping and the warmth of water do not operate without relying on effort and so on, because they are special once-done actions.

original: rten brtan pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rten brtan pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
translated: And they are not stable bases.

original: yang na 'di la yang rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon 'phel ba na zhes bya ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir mchongs pas 'khrul ba yin no snyam du sems na //
analyzed: yang na 'di la yang rigs mtshungs pa'i sa bon 'phel ba na zhes bya ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir mchongs pas 'khrul ba yin no snyam du sems na //
translated: Or, even in this case, if you think jumping is mistaken because it relies on the special condition of the seed of the same type increasing,

original: de ni mchongs pa nyid las min //
analyzed: de ni mchongs pa nyid las min //
translated: then that is not from jumping itself.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says:

original: mchongs pa de ni mchongs pa nyid las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mchongs pa de ni mchongs pa nyid las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: That jump does not arise from the jump itself.

original: 'o na gang zhig yod na 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig yod na 'byung zhe na /
translated: If it does not arise from the jump itself, from what does it arise?üîΩHe says:

original: stobs dang 'bad pa yod pa na //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: stobs dang 'bad pa yod pa na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When there is strength and exertion.

original: stobs dang 'bad pa yod na mchongs pa yin gyi mchongs pa yod na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stobs dang 'bad pa yod na mchongs pa yin gyi mchongs pa yod na ni ma yin no //
translated: If there is strength and exertion, there is a jump, but if there is a jump, there is not.

original: stobs dang 'bad pa de dag gi nus pa gnas pa nyid kyis mchongs pa yang gnas pa'i bdag nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩ'di snyam du gal te /
analyzed: stobs dang 'bad pa de dag gi nus pa gnas pa nyid kyis mchongs pa yang gnas pa'i bdag nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no // 'di snyam du gal te /
translated: The capacity of those strength and exertion is the very state of abiding, and the jump also has the nature of abiding.

original: stobs dang 'bad pa gnyis kho na las mchongs pa yin gyi mchongs pa las ni ma yin pa de lta na goms pa na skyes bu'i mchongs pa na ci 'dra bar goms pa las sngar yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: stobs dang 'bad pa gnyis kho na las mchongs pa yin gyi mchongs pa las ni ma yin pa de lta na goms pa na skyes bu'i mchongs pa na ci 'dra bar goms pa las sngar yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that if the jump arises from strength and exertion alone, not from the jump itself, then when one is accustomed to jumping, the jump of a person would be just as it was before, when one was not accustomed to jumping.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: sngar de'i lus bad kan la sogs @309b pa mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir phyis bzhin du mchongs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar de'i lus bad kan la sogs @309b pa mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir phyis bzhin du mchongs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: because previously it was made unfit by phlegm, etc.

original: phyis ni khyad kyi 'bad pas lus kyi mi mthun pa zad pa na mchongs pa'i stobs ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis ni khyad kyi 'bad pas lus kyi mi mthun pa zad pa na mchongs pa'i stobs ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: But later, when the unfitness of the body is exhausted by the power of the effort, the power of the jump is just as it was before.

original: 'di gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: This must be understood without doubt.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te mchongs pa nyid las mchongs pa yin par 'gyur na de'i mchongs pa'i khyad par du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te mchongs pa nyid las mchongs pa yin par 'gyur na de'i mchongs pa'i khyad par du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the jump were due to the jump itself, the jump would not be distinguished by the jump.üîΩOr, in another way, the jump that is distinguished by the cause is established as distinguished, and therefore it is not a fallacy.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rgyu'i khyad par la gnas pa'i mchongs pa yang khyad par du 'phags par gnas pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir des 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rgyu'i khyad par la gnas pa'i mchongs pa yang khyad par du 'phags par gnas pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir des 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni //
translated: To show this, he says,

original: yang na rab kyi mthar phyin pa //
analyzed: yang na rab kyi mthar phyin pa //
translated: Or, having reached the ultimate,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: 'di ltar mchongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because he possesses the special power of meditative stabilization,

original: kho bo cag gis shin tu phul du byung bar 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis shin tu phul du byung bar 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: we assert that he is the most excellent.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul mnga' bar bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul mnga' bar bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, the Bhagavat is said to possess the superknowledge called ‚Äúswift-mind.‚Äù

original: gnas la yid bzhin du mgyogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas la yid bzhin du mgyogs par 'gyur te /
translated: He can go to a place with the speed of mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni yid mgyogs zhes bya bar grags so //üîΩ'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa lang ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni yid mgyogs zhes bya bar grags so // 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa lang ma yin la /
translated: For that reason, he is renowned as ‚Äúswift-mind.‚ÄùüîΩThere is no valid cognition that contradicts this.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis spang bar rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis spang bar rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not right to reject this on the grounds of mere non-perception,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: gzhan yang rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par goms pa'i khyad par las 'gro ba shin tu 'phags pa mthong ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par goms pa'i khyad par las 'gro ba shin tu 'phags pa mthong ba kho na yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is seen that beings can be exalted through the special features of their support, that is, through the special features of their training.

original: de las kyang bcom ldan 'das la de lta bu'i 'gro ba srid pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las kyang bcom ldan 'das la de lta bu'i 'gro ba srid pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is possible that the Bhagavat has such exalted movement.

original: dad pa'i rgyal po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dad pa'i rgyal po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The king of swans, etc.

original: dper na ngang ba'i rgyal po'i phru gu sngar rang gi tshad las kyang 'byung bar mi nus pa'i phyis goms pa cung zad yod pa na gshogs pa skyes pa rgya mtsho'i pha rol du mchod par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ngang ba'i rgyal po'i phru gu sngar rang gi tshad las kyang 'byung bar mi nus pa'i phyis goms pa cung zad yod pa na gshogs pa skyes pa rgya mtsho'i pha rol du mchod par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the cygnet, though previously unable to fly beyond its own nest, later, when it has some familiarity, develops wings and flies to the far side of the ocean.

original: gzhan yang rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par goms pa'i khyad par las khyad par can gyi 'gro ba yang sgrub par byed do zhes bya bar srid pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par goms pa'i khyad par las khyad par can gyi 'gro ba yang sgrub par byed do zhes bya bar srid pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the special going of the special one is also accomplished through the special familiarity of the special basis.

original: gal te 'di gshog pa'i khyad par rnyed pa nyid kyi phyir yul thag ring por 'gro ba yin gyi goms pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di gshog pa'i khyad par rnyed pa nyid kyi phyir yul thag ring por 'gro ba yin gyi goms pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cygnet goes to a distant place because it has acquired special wings, not through the power of familiarity,

analyzed: bya'i phru gu gshog pa skyes na yang bab chol du 'phur zhing 'gro bar mthong ba ni ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na //

analyzed: ji ltar sngar nus pa med pa'i ngang ba la stsogs pa la yang rten gyi khyad par rnyed pa na phyis 'gro ba'i khyad par grub pa de bzhin du /

translated: in the same way, the BhagavƒÅn, when he was a bodhisattva, was unable to go to a distant place, but later, by achieving a special meditative stabilization, he established a special support and it became possible for him to go to a distant place.üîΩThus, through practice, he became endowed with the power to do so.

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par goms pa srid pa de ni shin tu ring du 'gro ba'i 'bras bu can du srid pa yin te /

analyzed: dper na dang po'i rgyal po'i phru gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the children of the first king.

analyzed: mi rnams kyi goms pa yang rten gyi bye brag gi khyad par can du srid pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the habituation of humans is possible with a difference in the particular support. This is a natural inference.üîΩTherefore, what was said,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de yang bsal ba yin no zhes ston pa ni //

analyzed: rten brtan pa ni zhes khyad par nye bar len pa'i phyir chu'i dro bas ma nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /

analyzed: 'di snyam du shes rab la sogs pa yang rten brtan pa nyid du ji ltar grub snyam du sems na /

analyzed: yid las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the continuum of the mind.

analyzed: rten dang brtan pas 'jug ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid kyi rten te gzhi dang ldan pas 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Thus, because the next world has already been established, and because bodhisattvas, who are of the nature of great compassion, remain for as long as samsara exists in order to rescue all sentient beings, the mental continuum that engages through them is a very stable basis.

analyzed: brtse ba dman pa de dag gnas par bya ba la 'bad pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //

original: gal te khyad par gnyis pa yang ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gnyis pa yang ji ltar grub ce na /

analyzed: 'di nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na //

original: de srid ches rab ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de srid ches rab ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúat that time, the most excellent‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di yang kho bo cag gi sngar bshad zin @310b to //
analyzed: 'di yang kho bo cag gi sngar bshad zin @310b to //
translated: This has been explained by us previously.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyis shes rab la sogs pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur ba yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //

translated: This is because wisdom and so on, whose nature is to see reality, are by nature mental states. This has been explained previously.

analyzed: khyad par gnyis pa yang grub pa yin no //

original: rnam par shes pa de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid du yang ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid du yang ji ltar grub ce na /

original: gal te sems ni gzhan rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: gal te sems ni gzhan rtogs pa'i //
translated: If the mind were to be understood by another mind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: de lta ma yin te gal te shes pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar gyur na de'i tshe dmigs pa ma grub pa nyid kyis don rig par grub par mi 'gyur ro //

translated: Otherwise, if it were to be understood by another consciousness, then at that time, since the object is not established, the establishment of the awareness of the object would not occur.

analyzed: de lta bas na sems kyi bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo ni gtso bo yin la /

original: bdag nyid de yang de'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis sems de kho na mthong ba'i bdag nyid du grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //

translated: And since that self is the nature of its impermanence and so on, it is implicitly established that the mind is the nature of seeing reality.

original: 'di snyam du sems de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin du chug mod /

translated: However, since it is possible that even those who have abandoned the defilements will be born again, all the previously stated reasons are indeterminate and difficult to refute.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To anticipate this qualm, the text says, ‚ÄúThe mind is not the self,‚Äù and so on.

original: lam gyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i phyir sngar yang gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma glo bur ba nyid kyis stobs chung ba'i phyir lam zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa de'i tshe lam bdag nyid du gyur ba yin pa ni ji ltar zilüîΩgyis gnon par 'gyur /
analyzed: lam gyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i phyir sngar yang gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma glo bur ba nyid kyis stobs chung ba'i phyir lam zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa de'i tshe lam bdag nyid du gyur ba yin pa ni ji ltar zilüîΩgyis gnon par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is the nature of the path, when the defilements such as attachment are weak due to being adventitious, they cannot overpower the path. At that time, the mind is the nature of the path. How can it be overpowered?

original: gzhan yang sems kyi yon tan de'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa ni gtsang sbra mkhan dang ro sreg mkhan gyi brtse ba med pa bzhin du 'bad pa med par spang bar nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems kyi yon tan de'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa ni gtsang sbra mkhan dang ro sreg mkhan gyi brtse ba med pa bzhin du 'bad pa med par spang bar nus pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the qualities of the mind are not able to be abandoned without effort, like the affection of a sweeper or a funeral attendant.

analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la mthong ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa srid pa yang ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of seeing the qualities.

original: 'di yang sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This has been explained previously.

original: skyon zhes bya ba ni nyes pa'o //üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na dngos po nyid la sogs pa khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir smras pa gang yin pa de @311a * //
analyzed: skyon zhes bya ba ni nyes pa'o // rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po nyid la sogs pa khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir smras pa gang yin pa de @311a * //
translated: ‚ÄúFault‚Äù means a shortcoming.üîΩIn one sense, you have said that all things, etc., are to be refuted in order to refute omniscience.

original: nyid kyis bsgrub par nus pa yin no zhes bstan par 'dod na /
analyzed: nyid kyis bsgrub par nus pa yin no zhes bstan par 'dod na /

analyzed: re zhig dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the specific reasons such as ‚Äúentityness,‚Äù ‚Äúcognizability,‚Äù and so on, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúMoreover . . . .‚Äù

original: de la 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di ni rtsa ba'i sbyor pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di ni rtsa ba'i sbyor pa yin te /

analyzed: dper na 'dod pa la sogs pas bslad pa rnams kyis bud med dang bu dang chom rkun la sogs pa bsgom pa bzhin no //

analyzed: chos thams cad kyang dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And all phenomena possess the qualities of entityness, cognizability, and so on. This is a natural reason.

original: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin te 'di ltar gang dang gang yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin par sgom par byed pa ni bsgom pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas na shes pa gsal bar snang ba'i 'bras bu can yin par grub ste dper na
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin te 'di ltar gang dang gang yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin par sgom par byed pa ni bsgom pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas na shes pa gsal bar snang ba'i 'bras bu can yin par grub ste dper na
translated: For example,

analyzed: 'dod pa can la sogs pa'i bud med la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //

original: chos thams cad kyang rtsa ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo sgom par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //

translated: And all phenomena are meditations on the nature of reality by those who have become the nature of roots and so on. This is a natural inference.

original: 'dis ni gsal bar snang ba'i shes pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis sgom par byed pa'i khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin te don gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //

translated: This teaches that meditation is pervaded by having the result of the appearance of clear consciousness, because it does not depend on another object.

analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'di'i de kho na nyid gsal bar snang ba nyid du ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is it established that the reality of this entity, emptiness, etc., is clearly manifest?üîΩThe entity of emptiness, selflessness, etc.

original: stong dang bdag med sogs ngo bo //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: stong dang bdag med sogs ngo bo // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is clearly manifest,üîΩbecause it is non-conceptual and non-erroneous.

analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yang mngon sum gyi tshad mar bsgrubs pa'i phyir mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: This cognition of emptiness, etc., is established as a valid cognition of direct perception, hence he says, ‚Äúdirect perception,‚Äù etc.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis rtog pa med pa dang / tshad mas grub pa'i don gyi yul can nyid kyi mi slu ba'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'di mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //

translated: It is a valid cognition of direct perception, like the cognition of the eye, etc., because it is non-conceptual due to its clear manifestation and because it is non-erroneous in regard to its object, the meaning that is established by valid cognition.

original: de lta yin dang gsal bar snang ba nyid du grub pa na chos thams cad ye shes gcig la cig car gsal bar snang ba grub pa'i phyir sgom pa can gyis 'byung ba'i khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gsal bar snang ba nyid du grub pa na chos thams cad ye shes gcig la cig car gsal bar snang ba grub pa'i phyir sgom pa can gyis 'byung ba'i khyab pa grub po //
translated: If that is so, then when the clear manifestation is established, the pervasion of the arising of the meditational object is established, because the clear manifestation of all things is established in a single cognition.

analyzed: de ltar rtogs par gyis shig / shes pa gcig la chos thams cad cig car mthong bar snang ba yin no zhes bya bar srid pa @311b yin no //

analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang shin tu bsgom pa de dag ni shes pa gcig la cig car gsal bar snang ba srid pa yin te /

original: dper na bud med la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bud med la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as a woman, etc., can.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúall phenomena are to be cultivated‚Äù is a natural inference.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthis is not unestablished‚Äù is stated to show that this inference is not unestablished.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthis is not unestablished‚Äù is stated to show that this inference is not unestablished.

original: chos thams cad kyang bsgom par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang bsgom par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //

analyzed: de'i bdag med pa ste rang bzhin med pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

original: 'di ltar dngos po gang dag ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gi nang nas gcig kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ye shes kyis mi mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin yod pa nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gang dag ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gi nang nas gcig kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ye shes kyis mi mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin yod pa nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: There is not a single thing among all the things that exist that is not experienced by the omniscient mind as having the nature of being known.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyis mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin nyid kho nar skye zhing 'jig pa yin te /üîΩgcig kyang yongs su btang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyis mkhyen pa'i rang bzhin nyid kho nar skye zhing 'jig pa yin te / gcig kyang yongs su btang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: However, the nature of being known arises and ceases only in the mind of the omniscient one.

original: mtha' dag 'dzin pa'i don yin la //
analyzed: mtha' dag 'dzin pa'i don yin la //
translated: Not a single thing is left out. This is the meaning of ‚Äúapprehending the entirety.‚Äù

original: de dag shes pa gcig gis khyab pa yang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag shes pa gcig gis khyab pa yang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is also the meaning of ‚Äúpervaded by a single consciousness.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas de dag mtha' dag gi sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du yang brjod par mi bya ste des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas de dag mtha' dag gi sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du yang brjod par mi bya ste des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: If it were not so, it would follow that it would have an end. Therefore, it should not be said that it is the referent of the word all.

original: gang yang / shes pa gcig la snang ba'i dngos po las gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ji ltar mtha' dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhes smras pa yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang / shes pa gcig la snang ba'i dngos po las gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ji ltar mtha' dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhes smras pa yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not correct to say that it does not have an end because it is determined that there is no other entity that appears to a single cognition.

original: 'di ltar shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i phyogs la shes pa'i bdag nyid la dngos po snang ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i phyogs la shes pa'i bdag nyid la dngos po snang ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, in the position that asserts cognition is without aspects, an entity does not appear to the nature of cognition.

original: 'on te yod pa tsam gyis des de dag rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yod pa tsam gyis des de dag rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But if it does exist, it is cognized by that.

original: gang gis shes par bya ba nyid kyis de dag mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur ba dngos po rnams yongs su ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mtha' yas pa nyid du khas len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis shes par bya ba nyid kyis de dag mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur ba dngos po rnams yongs su ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mtha' yas pa nyid du khas len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that things are accepted as infinite because of the very fact that they are not delimited in their nature.

original: 'on kyang yul khyab pa dang ldan zhing mtha' yas pa nyid kyi snod kyi 'jig rten mtha' yas shing sems can gyi 'jig rten gangs mtha' yas pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul khyab pa dang ldan zhing mtha' yas pa nyid kyi snod kyi 'jig rten mtha' yas shing sems can gyi 'jig rten gangs mtha' yas pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: However, the infinite extent of the world of the container is due to the infinite extent of the object-field and the infinite extent of the world of sentient beings is due to the infinite extent of the object-holder.

original: gang gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa yul 'dzin pa la sogs pa mtha' med pa nyid yin pa na 'ga' yang gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa yul 'dzin pa la sogs pa mtha' med pa nyid yin pa na 'ga' yang gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the object-holder, such as the apprehension of the object, etc., were not infinite, then it would be contradictory that anything would be apprehended.

original: gal te mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dzin na de ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dzin na de ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not apprehend the very fact that it is infinite, then how can one be omniscient?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de gang kho na'i phyir 'di mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa de kho na'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na mtha' med pa'i dngos po mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni 'khrul par 'gyur
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de gang kho na'i phyir 'di mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa de kho na'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na mtha' med pa'i dngos po mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni 'khrul par 'gyur
translated: If he were not, then apprehending a thing that is limitless as having limits would be mistaken.

original: ro // 'di ltar gang yod pa de ni yod pa nyid du 'dzin la /
analyzed: ro // 'di ltar gang yod pa de ni yod pa nyid du 'dzin la /
translated: Thus, he apprehends what exists as existent and

original: gang med pa de med pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni @328a * //
analyzed: gang med pa de med pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni @328a * //
translated: he apprehends what does not exist as nonexistent.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya la /
translated: This is called ‚Äúomniscience.‚Äù

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten la yang mtha' yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten la yang mtha' yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The world of sentient beings and the physical world also have no limits.üîΩBecause the omniscient one knows the limits of existence and nonexistence, he apprehends what does not exist as nonexistent and he sees what exists as existent.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mtha' dang ldan pas byas pa'i med pa la med pa nyid du 'dzin la yod pa yang yod pa nyid du gzigs pa las ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di snyam du rnam
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mtha' dang ldan pas byas pa'i med pa la med pa nyid du 'dzin la yod pa yang yod pa nyid du gzigs pa las ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di snyam du rnam
translated: How could he be called ‚Äúnot omniscient‚Äù?

original: pa med pa'i phyogs la yul 'dzin pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyogs la yul 'dzin pa mi 'thad de /
translated: In the system that does not assert aspects, the apprehension of objects is untenable.

original: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / de las so so la rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / de las so so la rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated in any way, and because it is not tenable to posit it as individual.

original: de ni rnam pa med pa'i phyogs dgod par mi bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa med pa'i phyogs dgod par mi bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: It is not to be posited as a partless entity,

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du sun phyung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du sun phyung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is completely refuted in every way.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni las so sor rnam par 'jog par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni las so sor rnam par 'jog par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: because omniscient knowledge is not asserted to be posited as individual actions,

original: de ni dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of all things.

original: gang gi phyir de ni sngon po kho na rig pa'am ser po kho na rig pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni sngon po kho na rig pa'am ser po kho na rig pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that it knows only blue or only yellow,

original: 'on kyang thams cad rig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad rig pa yin no //
translated: but rather it knows everything.

original: tshu rol mthong ba gang gis shes pa so sor nges pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa de la shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba gang gis shes pa so sor nges pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa de la shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opponent sees only a little, and his knowledge has a specific object, but that knowledge is partless.

original: las thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir las so sor rnam par 'jog pa mi 'thad pa'i skyon brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: las thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir las so sor rnam par 'jog pa mi 'thad pa'i skyon brjod pa yin te /
translated: The error is that it is not tenable to posit individual actions, because there is no difference between actions.

original: 'di ltar sngon po rig par byed pa yin gyi ser po'i ni ma yin no zhes nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po rig par byed pa yin gyi ser po'i ni ma yin no zhes nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, there is no certainty that consciousness is aware of blue but not yellow.

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad thams cad mkhyen par thal bar 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad thams cad mkhyen par thal bar 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that all ordinary beings would be omniscient.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni de 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir de mi 'dod pa'i thog tu gtong ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni de 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir de mi 'dod pa'i thog tu gtong ba ci zhig yod /
translated: But since omniscience is asserted to be just that, what is the point of rejecting it?

original: des na thams can mkhyen pa'i gnas skabs na rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rnam pa med par skye ba 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na thams can mkhyen pa'i gnas skabs na rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rnam pa med par skye ba 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, at the time of omniscience, it is not contradictory that consciousness arises without aspects through the power of yoga.

original: gal te blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i dngos po rnam par phye nas yongs su shes par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i dngos po rnam par phye nas yongs su shes par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin no //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIf you do not distinguish things to be adopted and to be rejected, you will not gain knowledge,‚Äù that is not so.

original: cig car mtha' med pa'i dngos po snang ba na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po snang ba 'gal bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: cig car mtha' med pa'i dngos po snang ba na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po snang ba 'gal bar 'gyur ram /
translated: If things that are simultaneously and infinitely many appear, does it contradict the appearance of things to be adopted and to be rejected?

original: mi 'gal na yang gzhan dang lhan cig snang ba'i blang ba dang dor bya'i dngos po de'i de kho na nyid nyams par 'gyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: mi 'gal na yang gzhan dang lhan cig snang ba'i blang ba dang dor bya'i dngos po de'i de kho na nyid nyams par 'gyur ba yin nam /
translated: If it is not contradictory, then does the reality of the things to be adopted and to be rejected that appear together with others deteriorate?

original: de kho na nyid mi nyams na yang rnam par phye ste snang bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mi nyams na yang rnam par phye ste snang bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If reality does not deteriorate, then do they not appear distinctly?

original: rnam par phye nas snang ba na yang gal te yongs su gcod par byed pa rjes la thob pa @328b dag pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de thams cad rjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas snang ba na yang gal te yongs su gcod par byed pa rjes la thob pa @328b dag pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de thams cad rjod par 'gyur na /
translated: Or, if they appear distinctly, then if the subsequent consciousnesses that are conceptual consciousnesses, which are pure mundane knowledge that ascertain them, arise, then at that time all of them would be expressed.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba sna tshogs pa snang ba na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po de yang snang bar mi 'gal zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba sna tshogs pa snang ba na blang ba dang dor ba'i dngos po de yang snang bar mi 'gal zhing /
translated: Since it is not contradictory that things to be adopted and to be rejected appear when a variety of objects of knowledge appear,

original: bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid mi nyams la rnam par phye nas snang la phyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis byung ba'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa yongs su gcod par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar de yang
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid mi nyams la rnam par phye nas snang la phyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis byung ba'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa yongs su gcod par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar de yang
translated: Because it does not degenerate the reality of the self, it is a consciousness that appears as an analysis and later is ascertained by the power of omniscient wisdom.

original: rnam par phye nas mi shes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas mi shes pa zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, how can it be called ‚Äúnon-knowledge of an analysis‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la re zhig klan ka 'di med do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la re zhig klan ka 'di med do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Thus it has been demonstrated that in the position of non-aspected cognition, this fault does not arise.

original: ci ste shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la rtsod par byed na de la yang 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la rtsod par byed na de la yang 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
translated: But if you argue that this fault arises in the position of cognition with aspects, then in that case also there is no contradiction.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar mtha' med pa'i dngos po mtha' med pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyams su myong ba de kho na ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs de dpag tu med pa'i dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid skye
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar mtha' med pa'i dngos po mtha' med pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyams su myong ba de kho na ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs de dpag tu med pa'i dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid skye
translated: Thus, just as an infinite thing is experienced as having an infinite number of aspects, in the same way, the mind of the Omniscient One arises to apprehend the aspects of infinite things.

original: ba 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ba 'gal ba med pa nyid de /
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: shes pa gcig la dngos po du ma'i rnam pa 'dzin par skye bar mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la dngos po du ma'i rnam pa 'dzin par skye bar mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in a single cognition arising to apprehend the aspects of many things.

original: gal te yod pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa gcig la rnam pa du ma nyid 'gal ba yin no zhe na ma yin te rnam pa rnams ni mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa gcig la rnam pa du ma nyid 'gal ba yin no zhe na ma yin te rnam pa rnams ni mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is contradictory for a single apprehension of an existent thing to have many aspects, that is not so, because the aspects are not real.

original: 'o na gal te gcig la rnam pa don dam pa pa rnams yod par gyur na de'i tshe gcig la sna tshogs pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gcig la rnam pa don dam pa pa rnams yod par gyur na de'i tshe gcig la sna tshogs pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that if the ultimate aspects exist in a single thing, then it is contradictory for the thing to be manifold,

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur ba kho na yin par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin par 'gyur ba kho na yin par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: we accept that the aspects are not real.

original: gal te de lta na 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na ma yin te yang dag pa ji ltar gnas pas yongs su shes pas na skyon med do //
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na ma yin te yang dag pa ji ltar gnas pas yongs su shes pas na skyon med do //
translated: If one says: In that case, because he possesses mistaken consciousness, the Omniscient One would be mistaken, that is not so, because he is completely aware of the way things are, so there is no fault.

original: gang gi phyir gal te mi bden pa bden pa nyid du 'dzin par byed na de ni bden pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te mi bden pa bden pa nyid du 'dzin par byed na de ni bden pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If one grasps what is not real as real, that would be real.

original: gang gi tshe mi bden pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pa rnams mi bden pa nyid du mkhyen pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi bden pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pa rnams mi bden pa nyid du mkhyen pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: But when the aspects of unreal natures are known to be unreal, how could there be error?

original: don las tha dad pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i rnam par 'dzin pa na don la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad byed pas na ji ltar 'khrul par mi 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: don las tha dad pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i rnam par 'dzin pa na don la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad byed pas na ji ltar 'khrul par mi 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one grasps the aspects that appear to consciousness as different from the object, then one would use expressions such as I see the object and so on. So how could there be no error? That is not so.

original: yang dag pa'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i thabs mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he knows the correct method.

original: gal te 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs su rigs pa spangs nas gtso bo ma yin pas don 'dzin par byed pa de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi phyir shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong @329a * //
analyzed: gal te 'dzin par byed pa'i thabs su rigs pa spangs nas gtso bo ma yin pas don 'dzin par byed pa de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par smra ba'i phyogs la shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong @329a * //
translated: If, as a means of apprehending objects, it abandons reason, and apprehends objects by means of something that is not the principal factor, then it would be mistaken.

original: ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan don 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan don 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Because, in the standpoint of those who advocate that consciousness has aspects, apart from the experience of the aspect that is the nature of consciousness, there is no other activity of apprehending objects.

original: de ji ltar 'dzin pa'i thabs su rigs pa'i bya bas don 'dzin pa 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'dzin pa'i thabs su rigs pa'i bya bas don 'dzin pa 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: So how could it be that, as a means of apprehending objects, the activity of reason apprehends objects in a mistaken way?

original: de bas na shes bya bzhin du shes pa gcig kyang mtha' med pa'i dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa skye ba'i phyir des mtha' med pa'i dngos po la khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shes bya bzhin du shes pa gcig kyang mtha' med pa'i dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa skye ba'i phyir des mtha' med pa'i dngos po la khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as there are objects, consciousness also arises as the apprehender of the aspects that exist in infinite things. Thus it expresses the difference between infinite things.

original: bdag nyid gang gis shes pa'i bdag nyid la dngos po rnams gsal ba de nyid kyis de'i rjes la thob pa'i dpyod pa'i sems kyis yongs su dpyod pa yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la dngos po rnams gzhan du yod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa gsal
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis shes pa'i bdag nyid la dngos po rnams gsal ba de nyid kyis de'i rjes la thob pa'i dpyod pa'i sems kyis yongs su dpyod pa yin gyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la dngos po rnams gzhan du yod pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa gsal
translated: By the very nature of the omniscient mind, things are clearly manifest, and by the very nature of the mind that analyzes the aftermath of that, things are thoroughly analyzed.

original: ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But things do not have the aspect of existing elsewhere in the omniscient mind.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gang ji snyed cig yod pa nyid du nyams su myong bad thams cad snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gang ji snyed cig yod pa nyid du nyams su myong bad thams cad snang ba yin te /
translated: What then? Whatever exists is experienced and appears in the omniscient mind.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa la dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bos nus pa thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang don thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa la dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bos nus pa thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang don thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind of omniscience is the unhindered power of the objective condition that gives rise to omniscience, and because mental consciousness has all objects as its domain.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan du yod pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa 'dzin pa skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan du yod pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa 'dzin pa skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
